questionTitle: I saw a thief take Norman's wallet so I ran ________ him, but I didn't catch him.
Could you ________ me to take back those library books tomorrow?
The new play at the National Theatre is well worth ________.
I'm not surprised you failed the exam. You ________ have worked harder.
________ no need to buy traveller's cheques since most countries take credit cards.
He retired early ________ ill-health.
________ did I have a headache, I also felt quite sick.
John, do you think you could ________ me $50?
They tell me he is ________ a lot of money in his new job.
Mr Hanley was ________ of stealing one of the office typewriters.
Simon tried harder than ________, but I'm afraid he failed the test yet again.
All traffic is being ________ because of the military parades.
Don't blame him ________ this; I am responsible for what has happened.
She often suffers ________ colds.
He ran so fast I couldn't catch up ________ him
He's never done any work. He lives ________ his mother.
The Inspectors' report ________ in its comments on the standard of reading and writing among school leavers.
Our car ________ in the street so you can see it through the window.
Due to the ________ of the materials needed to manufacture the product and the ever-increasing demand for it, it is highly probably that the final cost to the consumer will ________.
When I tried to walk I had a sharp ________ in my leg.
